newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai fund to float more baht bonds in Sept, Oct.
newsitem.headline: Thai fund to float more baht bonds in Sept, Oct.

text.p: Thailand's fund for Rehabilitation and Development of Finance Institutions said on Wednesday it would auction 4.0 billion baht (US$160 million) of bonds in September and October.
The Bank of Thailand-operated fund said in a statement it would float two-billion-baht, three-year bonds each on September 27 and October 25.
The fund last month issued a total of 6.0 billion baht of bonds to raise funds required to rescue ailing financial institutions.
Bangkok Bank of Commerce Plc was the most recent bank rescued by the state-run fund after the government took it over in May.
Central bank officials said BBC was saddled with over 70 billion baht of risky loans.
